entry.title: What’s New in SAP Central Business Configuration 2504 FD2
entry.content:
With the latest feature delivery (2504 FD2) for SAP Central Business Configuration, exciting new features are available. This blog post will provide you with a comprehensive overview.

Enhanced Transparency for Team Management

We’re pleased to announce a recent improvement to the Settings page. In an effort to increase transparency, we’ve introduced a new column to the Team table. This column will now display the e-mail addresses of the users assigned to the workspace, making it easier for you to manage and oversee your team members.

E-Mail column in the Team table

Optimized User Experience for Switching On Demo Data

We’ve enhanced the user experience for assigning deployment targets, giving the Assign Deployment Target dialog box a fresh new look. Depending on the system type, you may now have the option to easily switch demo data on or off up until scope confirmation. In addition, this action is logged as a dedicated entry in the Change Logs app to support audit requirements.

Demo Data column in the Assign Deployment Target dialog box

For a quick summary, check out this video about What's New in 2504 & FD2. Don’t forget to also use the What’s New Viewer on the SAP Help Portal, which provides further details and links about all the recent changes.

That wraps up the new features this time. Did you like this blog? If so, please leave us a thumbs up at the top. Also, make sure to follow the SAP Central Business Configuration tag or follow this dedicated blog collection to stay up to date with the latest blog posts.

Do you have any ideas on how to further enhance SAP Central Business Configuration? Go to the Customer Influence platform to submit an improvement request or vote for the ideas of others. This helps us understand your requirements even better and prioritize our work accordingly. We’re looking forward to your improvement requests.

entry.title: SAP Commerce Cloud Q2 ‘25 Release Highlights
entry.content:
In the "2025 State of B2B eCommerce Report," written in collaboration with MasterB2B, many organizations expressed challenges with transitioning from analog-focused operations to digital-centric models. The difficulty is compounded by a lack of digital expertise and specialization among many companies. 

 We understand these challenges, and in Q2 2025 we introduced numerous B2B commerce improvements, including the announcement of the B2B Self-Service Portal at SAP Sapphire, designed to support organizations in easing into this digital transformation and meeting growing B2B customer expectations. 

We invite you to explore these B2B enhancements and other important SAP Commerce Cloud updates from the last three months by joining our Q2 2025 Release Highlights webcast on July 8 to stay updated on our latest advancements. A replay will be available afterwards. 

 

Adaptive 


Accelerate the growth of your B2B commerce business quickly 
 SAP B2B Self-Service Portal is an SAP Cloud ERP add-on designed to provide customers with post-purchase transparency without the time, effort, or expense involved in a comprehensive commerce implementation. Customers can start small and launch in a matter of weeks using partner implementation packages. You can later expand to SAP Commerce Cloud, all without requiring data or environment migration. 

Buyers benefit by receiving real-time access to order information, delivery status, and invoices, reducing the load on inside sales and support teams. This allows your teams to focus on building relationships and value-generating tasks, leading to higher customer satisfaction and lower overall service costs. 

B2B Self-Service Portal 

Enhance the purchasing experience for B2B buyers 
 

SAP Commerce Cloud, Open Payment Framework launched in phases starting in Q4 2024, initially focusing on B2C payment processes. We have now expanded to include B2B payment capabilities, offering your B2B customers a streamlined and secure payment experience. This framework ensures proven security with built-in validation features, error handling, and feature toggles for a seamless, backward-compatible rollout. 

Additionally, to enhance customer flexibility, we support both account and digital payment options, all managed centrally through the Open Payment Framework. 

Improved useability and security with new SmartEdit enhancements 
 
We have made many improvements to SmartEdit to give users more control, flexibility, and security. 
Enhanced Page View gives you the ability to customize your page view based on your preferences. You can now show and hide columns, reorder columns, sort columns, change column width, and define the number of items to be displayed per page. The customization options enable more control and a smoother workflow. 

The Preview Selector has been enhanced to support the preview of content catalog versions for specific user groups, giving those groups access to see precisely the content you intend for them to view.  
Please view this article for more details on these SmartEdit updates.

 

Insightful 

 

Unlock the power of AI-driven commerce 

Elevate shopping experiences with our enhanced AI-based Shopping Agent. The Shopping Agent now lets customers add products to their cart, as well as provide the order number, date, shipping address and total, with conversational updates.  
 
The conversation flows naturally and saves the customer time with fast responses and actions. 

Add item to cart with Shopping Agent 

Streamline product management with reusable prompt templates for generating AI-powered product descriptions. Admins can create and manage prompt templates to save time while ensuring consistency and tailored branding across the product catalog. 

You can now easily connect AI Capabilities for SAP Commerce Cloud through Joule Premium for CX with external Product Information Management (PIM) systems and configure via Omni Commerce Connect Module (OCC). This offers unmatched flexibility and streamlines operations with the added AI capabilities.  

 

Connected 

 

 Automate notifications and ensure its delivery 

Use our configurable Event Notifications Framework to easily integrate with the system of your choice. We offer over 140 ready-to-use events like Order Placed, User Account Deleted, Product Reviewed, and many other transactional, user-based or backend events.  

Our Framework lets you send real-time messages to third-party systems by setting up Webhooks in Backoffice with a visual configurator. It simplifies integrations by reducing the need for custom code while increasing versatility. 

 To guarantee notifications make it to their destination, we’ve now introduced At-least-once delivery (ALOD) that automatically resends outbound webhook events that encounter failures. This ensures that crucial events are successfully delivered at least one time, safeguarding critical information. 

Webhook Events with At Least Once Delivery enabled 

Offer purchase flexibility with B2B PunchOut for Composable Storefront 

B2B Punchout makes it easy for buyers to explore a supplier's online catalog and conveniently save chosen items as a requisition in their procurement system. Users are automatically logged in and out through a seamless login process. 
 
With B2B PunchOut on the Composable Storefront, the shopping cart of your headless storefront serves as the basis for creating a purchase requisition, which is then sent for approval within the buyer's company. Once approved, the order is sent back to the supplier's site for processing. There's no checkout button on the cart page. Instead, when you're ready to complete your purchase, simply select "Back to Requisition" to wrap up the transaction in your procurement system. 
 

Shopping cart page in PunchOut session 
 

Display relevant documents on sales orders 

In the latest S/4HANA Order Management integration, you can now display documents in the order history, saving time and providing relevant product information. Documents attached to sales orders in SAP S/4HANA Sales, such as product specifications or special instructions, are displayed to provide greater visibility and convenience. 

Gain scalable B2B pricing with SAP Variant Configuration Pricing integration  

B2B customers gain scalable access to SAP S/4HANA pricing features for standard and configurable products during their shopping journey. 

This can be used as a pricing engine. The SAP Commerce Cloud integration with SAP Variant Configuration and Pricing enables complex B2B pricing use cases for physical and configurable products in product list and detail pages as well cart calculation and checkout.

Elevate your after-sales experience with Reverse.io 

We are excited to partner with Revers.io and expand SAP Order Management Services returns to offer a pre-composed solution that improves the post-sales experience. Revers.io streamlines return, repair, and product reuse processes. 

Benefit from an integrated self-service return and repair process, which connects automated workflows across the after-sales chain, reducing lead times and cutting reverse logistics costs. Additionally, the solution accelerates time-to-market and lessens the customer service workload. 

 

Revers.io 
 

Boost store associate productivity with Newstore 

Newstore has introduced a mobile-first, SAP-ready solution with pre-built integrations across SAP commerce solutions to deliver faster, smarter service in retail stores. The user-friendly associate app simplifies workflows, minimizes reliance on hardware, and bridges the gap between digital and in-store retail. Newstore enables efficient store fulfillment, task management, and personalized service to improve operations in high-touch retail environments. 

NewStore 

 

Additional 

 

Prepare for the busiest shopping season with 2025 Holiday Readiness Program 

The 2025 Holiday Season Readiness Program is designed to help you prepare for peak shopping periods. Register by August 29 to ensure smooth operations.  

The program is open to all SAP Commerce Cloud customers planning promotions for major holiday events like Singles’ Day, El Buen Fin, Black Friday/Cyber Monday, and the Christmas season. Though primarily aimed at B2C businesses, B2B and B2B2C customers expecting higher traffic during these times are also encouraged to participate. 

For more details on the above release features, check out the following resources: 

  • SAP Commerce Cloud Release Ready Kit 
  • Performance Optimization Best Practices 
  • SAP Commerce Cloud update cycle 
  • SAP Commerce Cloud Release Navigator single access point to release content 

SAP Help Portal 

  • SAP Commerce Cloud What’s New 

Please share your feedback in a comment and follow our SAP Commerce Cloud topic page to connect with the community!

entry.title: Transitioning from SAP Design Studio to Advanced Reporting Solutions
entry.content:
The landscape of business intelligence is transforming, and staying ahead means embracing change. With the deprecation of SAP Design Studio, businesses should transition their custom reports to more advanced technologies to ensure seamless data-driven decision-making and meet emerging business needs.

Understanding the Current Situation

SAP Design Studio applications were officially deprecated in the CE2102 release and are no longer available as of CE2108. As this technology is no longer supported, it's crucial for users to explore alternative solutions to recreate their reports. Continuing with Design Studio may lead to operational risks and hinder future innovation. Despite the ability to use custom Design Studio apps, it's strongly advisable to transition to newer technologies that promise support and advancement.

Customer Options for Rebuilding Reports

To support this transition, there are several effective options for rebuilding reports:

  • Rebuild Reports Using Multidimensional Data Grid
  • Rebuild Reports Using MDA
  • Rebuild Reports Using Review Booklet

Understanding the purpose and layout can refine your choice:

Multidimensional Data Grid

  • Purpose: Used for detailed, flexible analysis and visualization of large data sets.
  • Features: Allow users to switch between grid and graphical displays, with configurable settings.

 

 

Multidimensional Analysis

  • Purpose: Designed for detailed analysis and visualization
  • Features: Enables analysis across multiple dimensions using pivot tables and charts, with functions for slicing, dicing, and saving personal data views

 

Review Booklet

  • Purpose: Offers an aggregated data overview
  • Features: Predefined business pages that focus on presenting key insights

 

Select the appropriate report type according to your specific business requirements.

Exploring the Rebuild Path

Crafting a successful transition involves mapping the path from Design Studio to your chosen method.

  • Rebuild Reports Using Multidimensional Data Grid

Multidimensional Data Grid provides a straightforward solution for report rebuilding. Customers can easily create Multidimensional Data Grid reports by creating application in the APP View Browser. Detailed steps can be checked in the demo below or the blog.

DEMO

It offers simplicity and ease of use, making it ideal for those seeking minimal time investment and consultant involvement. 

  • Rebuild Reports Using MDA

MDA emerges as a compelling option with moderate complexity, promising regular updates and enhancements.

Before creating an MDA report, queries must be recreated in the APP Custom Analytical Queries and Services.

DEMO

Following this, create the MDA report in the APP Manage KPIs and Reports with a few steps—demonstrated in the demo.

DEMO

In a word, As the successor to Multidimensional Data Grid, MDA involves initial query recreation, yet balances time, cost, and the need to remain aligned with current trends and capabilities.

  • Rebuild Reports Using Review Booklet

The Review Booklet offers a comprehensive method for report reconstruction, characterized by higher complexity and the necessity to redesign report layouts.

Firstly, similar to MDA, customers need to recreate a query in the new APP Custom Analytical Queries and Services.

DEMO

Then Navigate Review booklet tab in the App Manage KPIs and Reports to create to create a new review booklet.

As the purpose and layout of review booklet is different with multidimensional report, customers need to redesign the report according to business needs.

Creating a Review Booklet in the Review Booklet Designer

While this demands significant time and consultant involvement, it assures regular updates, providing a future-proof solution for businesses with complex reporting needs.

Key Takeaway: Multidimensional Data Grid vs. MDA vs. Review Booklet

Each rebuilding strategy carries unique advantages:

  • Multidimensional Data Grid stands out for its simplicity.
  • Review Booklet offers a robust solution with ongoing updates but requires high initial complexity.
  • MDA provides a balanced approach, coupling moderate complexity with up-to-date features and regular enhancements.(Recommended)

 

Embracing change is essential in the journey towards more reliable, innovative reporting solutions. The transition from SAP Design Studio opens doors to enhanced analytical experiences and future-proof capabilities. This change is not just necessary, but a strategic advantage, setting up businesses for continued success in a data-driven world.

entry.title: Scope Transfer from SAP Business ByDesign to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Using Digital Discovery Assistant
entry.content:
Overview: 

 

Organizations moving from SAP Business ByDesign (ByD) to SAP S/4HANA Cloud often face the challenge of realigning their existing business scope with the new cloud-native solution. To simplify this process, SAP offers a digital accelerator: the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA) tool, which now supports scope transfer by uploading the Business Adaptation Catalog(BAC) file exported from SAP Business ByDesign.

In this blog, we’ll walk through how this feature supports customers in their journey—and why it’s a game-changer for implementation efficiency and accuracy.

 

Key Features:

  • Upload-Based Scope Mapping: Directly upload your Business Adaptation Catalog file from SAP Business ByDesign to DDA.
  • Automated Scope Suggestion: The DDA automatically suggests suitable scope items for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud based on your current ByD configuration.
  • Expert-Backed Logic: The underlying mapping has been curated by qualified consultants with deep expertise in both SAP Business ByDesign and SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.
  • Accelerated Fit-to-Standard Preparation: Significantly reduces the time required to prepare for the Fit-to-Standard workshops during the implementation phase.

How It Works:

Step 1: Exporting the Business Adaptation Catalogue (BAC) File from SAP Business ByDesign

Begin by exporting the Business Adaptation Catalog file from your SAP Business ByDesign system. This file contains all the necessary configuration data that will be used in the next steps.

  1. Navigate to the Business Configuration work center.
  2. Go to Implementation projects and select the latest Project 
  3. Edit the scope and navigate to Step 4
  4. Select the "Export" => Microsoft Excel
  5. Save the file to your local system.

Note: If the Import fails, then Open the exported file in Microsoft excel and perform the Save Operation (current workaround)

KBA : https://me.sap.com/notes/0003632177

 

Step 2: Uploading the BAC File to the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA)

Next, upload the exported Business Adaptation Catalog file to the DDA. The DDA is a powerful tool that helps in identifying the relevant scope items for your new SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud system.

  1. Access the DDA tool and start a new Assessment
  2. Complete the steps the Step 1 and Step 2. Select the option Installed base and choose New Implementation for the Question 3 in  Step 2A
  3. After you Add & Qualify the Opportunity, you should be able to Import the BAC under Import and Export tab in Import SAP Business ByDesign(ByD) Configuration - SAP Cloud Transition Factory section.

 

Step 3: Reviewing the Suggested Scope Items

Once the file is uploaded, the DDA will analyze the configuration data and propose relevant scope items. These proposal are based on the expertise of qualified consultants from both ByD and S/4HANA, ensuring that the transition is as seamless as possible.

  1. Review the suggested scope items.
  2. Make any necessary adjustments based on your specific business needs.
  3. Confirm the scope items to proceed with the transition.

Behind the Scenes

The scope mapping logic is the result of extensive collaboration between consultants specializing in SAP Business ByDesign and SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Their functional expertise ensures that the recommendations are:

  • Relevant and practical – tailored for real-world transition scenarios
  • Continuously updated – as new scope items and functionalities are released in S/4HANA Cloud
  • Aligned with industry best practices – supporting a smoother project start and faster value realization

This is the Baseline S4H Scope coverage fitting for Transition, there might be differences based on the Customer Industry or adoption of the solution. We are only mapping the standard process to the Baseline(no additional fee), non-baseline with non additional fee and finally with non-baseline with additional fee . Partner/Project functional consultants who are more aware of the Customer need to accept/veto the scope mapping based on Customer need/adoption potential of the S4H Public cloud solution. We propose this as a accelerator potentially.

Why It Matters: From Configuration to Realization

Here’s how this feature adds value for customers:

  • Faster Scoping: Skip hours of manual scoping by letting DDA analyze your existing setup.
  • Reduced Risk: Reliably align existing business processes with supported S/4HANA Cloud scope items.
  • Guided Transformation: Move from ERP concepts in ByD (like work centers and activity sets) to scope items and fit-to-standard in S/4HANA Cloud.
  • Accelerated Fit-to-Standard: Start implementation workshops with a pre-defined, pre-mapped scope that reflects your current business practices.

Start your transformation journey with confidence—leverage this accelerator to bridge the gap between SAP Business ByDesign and SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. We're excited to hear your feedback and continuously improve this offering based on real customer experiences.

entry.title: Track Your Cloud Journey: New Onboarding Milestones in SAP EarlyWatch Alert
entry.content:
We are excited to introduce a brand-new chapter in the SAP EarlyWatch Alert (EWA) Report for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition systems: “Onboarding Progress.” This new addition offers enhanced visibility into the onboarding journey of customers, helping project teams and stakeholders track their implementation progress against key milestones - right from initial system provisioning to full production usage.

Why a New Chapter?

The onboarding process in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition follows a structured methodology, yet customers often need more proactive and transparent tracking across the various phases. With the Onboarding Progress chapter in the EWA report, customers now have a standardized, data-driven view of where they are in their journey and actionable guidance on what steps to take next.

Six Milestones on the Journey to Go-Live

The chapter highlights six essential onboarding milestones and evaluates customer progress using real usage data from the systems:

  1. System Setup – Test system was deployed
    The journey begins with the provisioning of the test tenant. This signals the start of onboarding activities.

  2. Access Test System – First logins of business users in the test system
    Once users start interacting with the system, configuration and exploration can begin.

  3. Start Data Load – First data migration into the test system
    Initial data loads indicate that migration planning and execution are underway.

  4. Access Prod System – First logins of business users in the production system
    This marks the start of cut-over preparations and familiarization with the live environment.

  5. Start Cut-Over – First data migration into the production system
    Data is now being finalized and validated for go-live.

  6. System Go-Live – Business users are using the production system intensely
    A major milestone confirming that business operations are running in the live environment.

Actionable Insights & Recommendations

Each milestone is not just a checkpoint - it’s a launchpad for action. The report provides practical recommendations tailored to your system’s current status. Whether it’s attending webinars, setting up initial user roles, beginning test cycles, planning cut-over, or initiating hypercare, the chapter offers next steps to help accelerate onboarding and stay aligned with best practices.

Report Examples

The following 2 screenshots showcase how the chapter looks like for a system, which is already used productively:

 


Benefits at a Glance

  • Real-time transparency into onboarding progress

  • Automated tracking of key milestones using system telemetry

  • Guided next steps to maintain project momentum

  • Standardized view across customer projects for partners and SAP stakeholders

Available Now

The Onboarding Progress chapter is automatically included in the SAP EarlyWatch Alert Report for eligible SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition systems. No additional configuration is required - just open your latest EWA report and look for the new section.

You can check the SAP EarlyWatch Alert Solution Finder application to find the new Onboarding Progress content there.

Explore the new chapter today - and accelerate your path to a successful go-live!

entry.title: SAP Sustainability Footprint Management: Q2-25 Updates & Highlights
entry.content:
In the past quarter, we continued delivering many more useful features and functions in SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, and we achieved great success stories together with our customers. This blog post continues my quarterly series and gives you an overview of some of the highlights. In this edition, I’m covering:

  • Streamlined Location Management with Cost Center Assignment
  • Calculate Consumed Energy using Meter Readings and Planned Energy Consumption Rates
  • Default Emission Factors from UK DEFRA and EMBER
  • Simplified Data Integration
  • Other Release Highlights
  • Catena-X Certification
  • SAP Innovation Award Wins: Harting and Matsumoto Precision
  • Customer Success Story: DMK
  • SAP Runs SAP Sustainability Footprint Management
  • Learning Journey: PCF Calculation

 

Streamlined Location Management with Cost Center Assignment

When integrating SAP Sustainability Footprint Management with various SAP systems, you often face a data challenge: Your warehouse in one SAP solution might be a facility in another or even a resource elsewhere. This inconsistency complicates footprint calculations, energy flow modeling, and linking environmental results to financials.

To address this and streamline and simplify the management of location data, we released the new Manage Locations application. This app serves as a single source for managing all locations, regardless of origin or business context. It addresses the need to reconcile and correlate locations that may have different semantics across multiple SAP solutions. With this new app you can:

  • View and manage all locations in one consolidated interface
  • Manually create locations or view those imported from other SAP modules
  • Easily distinguish between manually created and imported locations via the user interface
  • Navigate via links between imported location records and their corresponding system-generated system entries

Alternatively to replicating locations from source systems or creating them manually, you can upload location information via Excel files in the Import Master Data app. When importing, the software automatically generates corresponding location records that appear in the Manage Locations app – ensuring no duplicated or orphaned records. The locations itself are categorized into different location types, adding business context: Meter, Process Infrastructure, and Facility. Imported locations are automatically mapped to one of these three types. If a location type doesn’t match, it defaults to Facility. For modeling energy flows, you can now use these harmonized locations and resources as elements in your models. Hence, the creation of meters, process infrastructures, and facilities within the Model Energy Flows app is now managed exclusively via the new Manage Locations app – ensuring data consistency across apps.

Another major improvement is the possibility to assign cost centers for financial transparency and connecting carbon footprint results directly with your financial reporting. These assignments are time-dependent, ensuring correct mapping for each period. After calculating your organizational footprint, the Manage Footprint Results app shows the active cost center for that location – specifically, the cost center that is valid as of the calculation period’s start date, which is important if multiple cost centers are assigned to the location. Besides locations, cost centers can now also be assigned to energy sources in the Model Energy Flows app. This enables better tracking of spending related to energy use and maintenance, helping to analyze and manage energy costs more effectively.

Click the picture to start the video:

Manage Locations App (Click to start video)

To summarize, these enhancements bring you a centralized, consistent interface for all location data with improved usability and a simplified integration across various SAP systems. The flexible cost center assignment enables the linkage of environmental data to financial entities. This empowers smarter and holistic decision-making in sustainability management, moving further along the journey towards ledger-based carbon accounting with SAP Green Ledger. For all details, see Manage Locations on SAP Help.

 

Calculate Consumed Energy using Meter Readings and Planned Energy Consumption Rates

A common challenge for calculating Scope 1 and 2 emissions is the timely availability of energy bills needed for accurately recording energy consumption. SAP Sustainability Footprint Management addresses this by introducing more flexibility in how energy data can be captured. Now, when creating energy sources, you can select your preferred method for recording energy consumption, with the two available options:

  • Actual Consumption from Energy Bills: Enter the actual quantities consumed as detailed on your energy bills (the most accurate method).
  • Estimates via Meter Readings and Planned Energy Consumption Rates: Add up amounts based on assigned meter readings and planned energy consumption rates, which allows you to work with estimates when bills are unavailable.

Select Recording of Energy Consumption

This new functionality isn’t limited to newly created energy sources. You can apply it to existing ones as well. However, it’s important to note that updating an energy source with this new logic doesn’t automatically trigger updates across all footprint inventories. If you edit the inventories that reference the updated energy source in their energy flow models, the system will recalculate using the newly selected consumption recording logic.

This release gives you the flexibility to maintain complete and more timely energy consumption records, improving the reliability of your sustainability data even when actual energy bills are delayed or not available at all. For more information, see the Energy Sources section under Model Energy Flows.

 

Default Emission Factors from UK DEFRA and EMBER

For calculating carbon footprints with no actual supplier or provider data available, it’s crucial to have access to reliable industry average data from Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) databases. SAP Sustainability Footprint Management provides you with the flexibility to upload respective data from any source into the Manage Emission Factors app. To simplify the setup for you and reduce manual efforts, we now added new default content, available for mapping your activities for calculating the respective footprints.

The data from UK Department for Energy Security and Net Zero and UK Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs (UK DEFRA) includes emission factors for energy use, water consumption, waste disposal, recycling, and transport activities. There are datasets available for the years 2015 to 2024.

EMBER, an independent energy think tank, provides emission factors for electricity generation for over 200 geographies. The datasets comprise the years 2015 to 2023.

Click the picture to start the video:

Default Emission Factors in SAP Sustainability Footprint Management (Click to start video)

With those enhancements, you have access to additional reliable and diverse data sources for better environmental impact analysis and decision-making. For more information, see Using Default Emission Factor Data.

This new content complements the datasets from the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) which were already added last year. And for the second half year we plan to add even more pre-configured emission factors from additional sources, further enhancing your carbon footprint calculation. The addition of emission factors was also one of the highest voted items on SAP Influence, requested by several customers and partners. Thanks to your valuable feedback, we’re constantly improving our product.

 

Simplified Data Integration

SAP Sustainability Footprint Management introduced significant enhancements to how sustainability data is imported and managed, making processes more simple, efficient, and user-friendly. The tool leverages the sustainability data integration service to streamline data import from SAP systems, including SAP S/4HANA, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and SAP Environment, Health and Safety Management. This update eliminates many manual steps and unifies the process across systems. All changes are reflected in the updated SAP Sustainability Footprint Management Implementation Guide on SAP Help Portal.

With those enhancements, we’re also introducing the Manage Replications application. This new app allows you to configure and manage the replication of master data objects, such as products or suppliers, from multiple integrated SAP systems. Once replication is initiated through this app, imported data becomes visible in the Import Master Data app, simplifying subsequent data management tasks. The key benefits for you are:

  • Multi-source replication: Import master data from various source systems (for example fetch Products from SAP S/4HANA and Suppliers from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition).
  • Centralized management: Oversee and control all data replications from one place.
  • Improved data consistency: Ensures data is harmonized and consistent, provided the correct source systems are chosen for each data object.
  • Filter records: For some of the entities, like Products, you can filter the source data objects so only the ones which are relevant in your footprint calculation are replicated.

To use the Manage Replications app, users must be manually assigned the roles: SUS_Replication_Viewer or SUS_Replication_Expert. Find further information as well as all details on the new app in SAP Help: Manage Replications.

Manage Replications App

For existing customers, the following changes are required:

  • Switch to Manage Replications App: The previous method of importing master data directly within the Import Master Data app is discontinued for integrated source systems. The Import button has been removed, and all such imports must now be managed through the new Manage Replications app.
  • SAP EHS Management Integration: All emissions management activities and locations must now be imported via the Manage Replications app.
  • Replication Details: When replicating Suppliers or Emission Management Activities, each replication now performs a complete import – incremental or delta updates are no longer supported for these entities.

Those updates vastly improve the efficiency and governance of sustainability data management within SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, offering you a more powerful, secure, and streamlined experience when handling master data from multiple integrated sources.

 

Other Release Highlights

The Monitor Plausibility Checks app displays reference details of the item, period, and measure value used as the baseline for creating relative plausibility alerts. This helps you assess how much actual results deviate from expected calculations. For more information, see Monitor Plausibility Checks. This is also a feature that was implemented after numerous customers requested it via SAP Influence.

A new Generate Records button in the Manage Purchased Products Footprints app allows you to manually generate records for purchased products and product groups that lack footprints. Progress is displayed during record generation, and users are notified if records need to be regenerated due to data updates, ensuring accuracy and control. Additionally, the UI in the related tabs now labels the AI-assisted mapping button as Generate Mappings Using AI. See Manage Purchased Product Footprints for more details.

We achieved significant performance improvements in cycle calculations, where a process's output becomes its own input. Previously, the runtime increased with the cycle's complexity. Now, calculations are done in-memory rather than relying on database access, greatly reducing calculation time and improving user efficiency.

SAP now offers real-time machine translation for documentation on the SAP Help Portal, including SAP Sustainability Footprint Management. This increases the number of available languages, improving accessibility and availability of product information for users worldwide.

To help you with onboarding and using SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, we’re also constantly enhancing the product documentation on SAP Help. In the previous quarter, this included the following topics:

  • Energy carrier assignment per internal service confirmation: The new topic in the Energy Distribution Scenarios section explains two different methods for assigning energy to production documents using data from internal service confirmations, see Energy Carrier Assignment per Internal Service Confirmation.
  • Modeling consistent energy flows: Useful guidance on using energy elements in flow models and explanations on how different components are connected, see Modeling Consistent Energy Flows.
  • Energy distribution scenarios: The updated explanation details how energy consumption and distribution are modeled via the energy flows, using planned rates, meter data, or both, see Energy Distribution Scenarios.
  • Importing master data for Products using file upload: An example explains how to enter data for quantity conversions and quantity dimensions, see the section Example: Quantity Conversions and Dimensions in Products.
  • Data Inconsistencies: Guidelines on addressing these issues, see Business Transaction Data Consistency for details.
  • Delete imported business transaction data: More details on how to handle this process, see Deleting Business Transaction Data.

 

Catena-X Certification

In Q2, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management successfully was Catena-X certified by Cofinity-X, as the first carbon calculation software to receive this certification. Catena-X is the automotive industry’s open, collaborative data ecosystem, designed to facilitate secure and standardized data exchange across the entire value chain. With this certification, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management meets the rigorous calculation, interoperability, and data sovereignty standards required by Catena-X, enabling customers to seamlessly calculate and share trustworthy carbon footprint and sustainability data with partners, suppliers, and customers in the ecosystem. This not only supports regulatory and customer-driven transparency requirements but also paves the way for scalable decarbonization efforts in the automotive industry and beyond. By aligning with Catena-X, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management empowers organizations to participate confidently in cross-company sustainability initiatives within a rapidly evolving digital value network. With the integration to SAP Sustainability Data Exchange, carbon footprint data can be exchanged automatically and seamlessly.

 

Innovation Award Wins

We’re very proud to announce that two of our SAP Sustainability Footprint Management customers won the SAP Innovation Award 2025 in the Sustainability Hero category: Harting Technology Group and Matsumoto Precision!

Faced with the challenge of calculating carbon footprints for over 100,000 products across 14 factories, HARTING Technology Group needed a scalable, integrated solution. By becoming an early pilot customer of SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, HARTING automated emissions tracking and achieved one-click carbon footprint calculations for 13,000 products – replacing a manual, time-consuming process. The solution, now live in three factories and expanding to all 14 by 2026, enables real-time, granular CO₂ data that supports HARTING’s “GreenLine” product label and helps meet stringent EU regulations like the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) and the Digital Product Passport. Thanks to this innovation, HARTING can now report that 85% of its packaging materials are recycled, and it has a clear path to achieving net-zero operations by 2030. This collaboration with SAP not only enhances transparency and compliance but also gives HARTING a competitive edge in customer bids – proving that sustainability and business success go hand in hand. Read the whole story here: HARTING - SAP Innovation Awards 2025.

To address the growing demand for carbon transparency and operational efficiency, Matsumoto Precision implemented SAP S/4HANA alongside SAP Sustainability Footprint Management. This combination gave the company real-time visibility into both product-level carbon emissions and profitability. With this data-driven approach, Matsumoto Precision was able to reduce its annual CO₂ emissions by 400 tons, increase productivity by 30 percent, and improve its operating profit margin by 3 percent. The factory now runs entirely on renewable energy, with on-site solar generation covering a significant portion of its needs. The implementation also empowered employees with real-time insights, leading to better decision-making and increased job satisfaction. Customers now receive verified carbon footprint data for each product, enhancing trust and supporting their own sustainability goals. In collaboration with Accenture, Matsumoto Precision even developed a generative AI tool that automates lifecycle flow diagrams, significantly reducing manual effort and streamlining emissions reporting. As CEO Toshitada Matsumoto put it, “With SAP S/4HANA and SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, we make smarter, greener decisions while tracking and visualizing CO₂ emissions for each product. And with this clarity, we can enhance our brand value.” Matsumoto Precision’s journey is a compelling example of how small and mid-sized manufacturers can lead the way in sustainable innovation by embedding carbon intelligence into every layer of their operations. Read the full story here: Matsumoto Precision Co., Ltd. - SAP Innovation Awards 2025.

 

Customer Success Story: DMK

Germany’s largest dairy cooperative, DMK Deutsches Milchkontor GmbH, is leading the way in sustainable food production. Processing over 5.3 billion kilograms of milk annually, DMK is committed to reducing its environmental impact across the value chain. With ambitious climate goals – including a 42% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 2030 – DMK turned to SAP Sustainability Footprint Management to bring transparency and precision to its carbon accounting.

By implementing SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, DMK transformed how it calculates and manages product-level emissions. The solution enabled the company to move beyond industry averages and instead use granular, actual data to assess the carbon footprint of its milk-based products. This shift provided DMK with unprecedented transparency and accuracy, particularly in understanding and reporting Scope 3 emissions from its upstream value chain, such as milk production and transportation.

The digitalization of carbon footprint management not only helped DMK meet regulatory requirements but also strengthened its ability to respond to customer demands for credible, verifiable sustainability metrics. With SAP’s expert support and a tailored pilot program, DMK integrated emissions data directly into its product lifecycle, enabling more strategic decision-making and targeted decarbonization efforts.

This collaboration has positioned DMK as a leader in sustainable dairy production, demonstrating how digital tools can drive real progress toward climate goals while enhancing trust and transparency across the value chain. Read the full story here: DMK: Identifying the carbon footprint of milk-based products on the way to decarbonizing the value chain.

 

SAP Runs SAP Sustainability Footprint Management

SAP’s commitment to sustainability is integrated into its core mission of improving economic, social, and environmental outcomes while respecting planetary and human rights boundaries. SAP is actively using its own sustainability software solutions to meet environmental and social goals, demonstrating an “SAP runs SAP” and “customer zero” approach. By implementing tools like SAP Green Ledger, SAP Sustainability Control Tower, and SAP Sustainability Footprint Management within its operations, SAP treats sustainability management with the same rigor as financial reporting.

As a user, SAP faces challenges similar to its clients: collecting and managing large volumes of sustainability data, ensuring compliance with evolving regulations, and integrating data systems across the organization and supply chain. By implementing its sustainability solutions and continuously refining them through hands-on experience, SAP gains valuable insights that help improve its products for clients. Key lessons from their internal adoption include: ensuring consistent emissions data collection, grounding projects within governance frameworks, expanding focus beyond carbon to other environmental factors, and establishing a multi-layer data architecture for effective collection, processing, and reporting. The rollout of these systems is iterative, enabling refinement and adaptation—especially important as regulatory requirements change, such as the new EU Omnibus package. Overall, SAP aims to provide actionable sustainability insights, streamline ESG reporting, and drive both internal and customer progress toward measurable sustainability outcomes. To learn more, read the news article from Matthias Medert, SAP’s global head of Sustainability: SAP Runs Its Own Solutions for Sustainability Goals.

A central piece of the SAP runs SAP Sustainability IT architecture is SAP Sustainability Footprint Management:

SAP Runs SAP Sustainability - IT Architecture

By implementing SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, SAP has created a centralized and integrated platform to collect and calculate its corporate carbon emissions. The ambition is clear: to achieve full coverage of SAP’s carbon footprint through automated data collection and calculation. The software is much more than just a reporting tool, it acts as a central hub for emissions data, feeding into other SAP sustainability solutions such as the SAP Green Ledger, the SAP Sustainability Control Tower, and various internal systems. This enables comprehensive environmental impact analysis and supports regulatory compliance, while also informing strategic business decisions. Currently, SAP has already validated around 50% of its corporate carbon footprint within SAP Sustainability Footprint Management. This includes emissions from its own facilities like offices and data centers, as well as from shared infrastructure, cloud providers, and purchased goods and services.

The journey hasn’t been without challenges. At the outset, SAP faced difficulties in gathering and harmonizing data from multiple sources, each managed by different internal teams. Some of the data also required enrichment to be usable for sustainability purposes. However, through close collaboration between internal IT and business units, these hurdles were largely overcome, resulting in a more consistent and unified data flow.

Looking ahead, SAP aims to expand the system’s coverage to 100% of its corporate carbon footprint (excluding downstream emissions) before the planned business go-live in Q3. This milestone will involve five company codes and marks a significant step toward embedding sustainability deeper into SAP’s operations. All of this is being achieved through a continuous co-innovation process with SAP’s sustainability product engineering teams, demonstrating how SAP isn’t only building tools for others but also using them to lead by example. For all details, read the paper SAP runs SAP Sustainability: How to unlock the Power of Data on Sustainability Goals at Scale.

 

Learning Journey: PCF Calculation

The new Learning Journey Establishing the Product Carbon Footprint with SAP Sustainability Footprint Management is the first one that focuses on Product Carbon Footprint (PCF) calculation. The one-hour self-learning is as all our Learning Journeys free of charge and targets consultants and business users with advanced product knowledge. It explains distributing Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions to products via various methods and covers how to use the energy flow model and planned consumption rates for Scope 1 and 2, as well as additional allocation schemes for Scope 3 emissions. By completing this journey, users will be able to calculate and allocate emissions from business activities, energy use, and resources to products, leveraging dedicated models and production documents. You’ll also earn a Record of Achievement and a digital badge after successful completion and passing all quizzes.

Learning Journey: Establishing the Product Carbon Footprint with SAP Sustainability Footprint Management

This new PCF-centric Learning Journey complements our existing courses focusing on CCF calculation for beginners (Establishing Corporate Carbon Footprint Emissions with Simple Configuration) and intermediates (Establishing Corporate Carbon Footprint Emissions with Advanced Configurations).

 

Additional Information

To get more insights about the integration between SAP S/4HANA, SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, SAP Sustainability Data Exchange, and SAP Green Ledger, you should check out the blog post Where finance and carbon unite by @PreethaB. With a practical example, she explains how to track carbon throughout business processes and incorporate sustainability into operations. By showing the complete workflow, it’s demonstrated how integrated solutions provide valuable sustainability insights, support informed decision-making, help achieve sustainability goals, and improve operations.

For in-depth details on SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, including concepts, setup, and the application help, I recommend you browsing through the SAP Help Portal. For an overview of all new features and functions that have been released, check the What’s New section, which is updated with every new software release.

For exploring and experimenting in a live system, register for the free SAP Sustainability Footprint Management Trial. You’ll receive an e-mail with access information within seconds after your registration and can then test the solution at your own convenience within a 30-day trial period. It also includes a wide range of guided tours designed to help you navigate through all the features and functions comprehensively. Recently, we also added new tours and will shortly release additional ones, representing the latest features and an enhanced user experience.

To stay up to date on SAP Sustainability Footprint Management, follow me here in the SAP Community. In regular cadence, I’ll publish blog posts giving you updates on all the product’s new features and functions as well as deep dives into the product capabilities. I’m also looking forward to engaging with you directly, feel free to leave your feedback in the comment section.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition seamless integration with Shopify - Complete Setup and Demo Guide
entry.content:
Tired of Juggling Data Between SAP and Shopify? We’ve Got You Covered!

Managing data and business processes across SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Shopify can often be a challenging and time-consuming task — especially when done manually or through custom-built integrations. That’s why we’re excited to introduce a ready-to-use integration package powered by SAP Integration Suite, built to simplify and streamline your operations.

Designed specifically for B2C commerce scenarios, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify integration package ensures:

  • Seamless data synchronization between SAP and Shopify
  • Automated workflows for key business processes
  • A reduction in manual tasks and potential errors

In this blog, we’ll start with a high-level overview of what the integration offers. Then, we’ll walk you through a step-by-step guide to setting up the package — so you can get your systems connected and running efficiently with minimal effort.

Note : SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify integration package accelerator isn’t just limited to B2C. Partners can extend the integration to support B2B use cases as well, tailoring it to fit the needs of more complex business models. The package is built with extensibility in mind, so partners can enhance it further to accommodate specific business requirements or tailor it to specific industry needs.

Overview of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify Integration Package:

SAP provides a variety of pre-built integration accelerators via the SAP Integration Suite, all accessible through the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Among these, we’ve developed a dedicated Shopify integration accelerator that enables a seamless connection between your Shopify storefront and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

The  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify integration package ensures real-time data consistency across both platforms by synchronizing key business objects such as:

  •  🛒  Product information
  •  📦  Inventory levels/Product Stock
  • 💲Product Prices & Discounts 
  •  👤  Customer information

By automating critical business processes like order creation, cancellations, and returns, the integration reduces manual effort, minimizes errors, and increases operational efficiency. It also synchronizes shipping and delivery details, helping you provide accurate and timely updates to customers — a key to delivering a superior B2C customer experience.

The Shopify Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud package is designed to integrate key end-to-end business processes between SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Shopify, enabling smooth, automated data flow and operational consistency across both platforms.

The following core business processes are supported out of the box:

📦 From SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify:

  • ✅ Replicate Products – Ensure accurate and up-to-date product information is reflected in your Shopify storefront.
  • 📊 Replicate Product Stock – Keep inventory levels in sync to avoid overselling or stockouts.
  • 💲 Replicate Product Prices & Discounts – Automatically update pricing and promotional details in Shopify.
  • 🚚 Replicate Delivery Details – Provide timely and accurate shipping information to your customers via Shopify.

🛒From Shopify to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

  • 👥 Replicate B2C Customers – Capture and transfer customer data from Shopify to SAP, enabling centralized customer management.
  • 🧾Replicate Orders – Seamlessly transfer incoming sales orders into SAP for fulfillment and processing.
  • ❌ Replicate Order Cancellations – Reflect cancelled orders in SAP for proper stock and financial reconciliation.
  • 🔁 Replicate Order Returns – Automatically push return details from Shopify into SAP to streamline reverse logistics.

Together, these integration flows deliver a robust, automated B2C commerce experience, reducing manual interventions and ensuring your front-end and back-end systems remain in sync.

🚀 How to Set Up the “Shopify Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition” Package

Integrating Shopify with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is now easier than ever — thanks to the pre-built accelerator available on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. This step-by-step guide will help you configure and deploy the integration package using SAP Integration Suite, so your systems can work together seamlessly.

✅Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following:

  • 🔑  An SAP Partner Account with access to SAP Integration Suite (via SAP BTP – Business Technology Platform).
  • 🧾 Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • 🛍  A Shopify Partner or Merchant Account.
  • 📘  Basic knowledge of SAP BTP, Integration Suite and Shopify. 
  • 🌐  Access to SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  • 📘Detailed Configure Guide - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub

 🛠️  Step 1: Set Up SAP Integration Suite instance using SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) account.

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit.
  2. Create a Subaccount and enable Integration Suite:
    • Navigate to your Global Account > Subaccount.
    • Create or open an Integration Suite instance.
    • Assign relevant entitlements and Assign relevant roles
    • Use the Booster Enable Integration Suite to automate setup or configure manually
    • for more details refer to sap help documentation SAP Integration Suite | SAP Help Portal

📦 Step 2: Import the Shopify Adapter Package into SAP Integration Suite

  1. Goto SAP Integration Suite instance
  2. Go to Discover tab.
  3. Search for “Shopify Adapter for SAP Integration Suite”.
  • Click “Copy” to add / move the package to your Design workspace.

  • To Configure Shopify Adapter Installation - Installing the Shopify Adapter is a prerequisite to use the Integration Content. For adapter installation, refer to the “Shopify Adapter Guide” and to the “Shopify Adapter and Plug-in Installation Guide” and also refer to more details refer to section "Shopify Adapter Installation" in configuration guide SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

🔄Step 3: Configure Shopify iFlows (Integration Flows) with API access relevant details.

  1. Go to Design > Integrations in the Integration Suite.
  2. Open the imported Shopify Integration Package.
  3. Select a relevant iFlow (e.g., Replicate Orders from Shopify to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition).
  4. Configure the necessary Externalized Parameters and Connections, referencing the detailed documentation for each Integration Flow.
  5. To Configuration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - the mandatory configurations which need to be performed in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition before you can start implementing the configuration for Shopify API and configuring the Integration Content in SAP Integration Suite and for more details refer to section "Configuration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition" in configuration guide SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify Configuration Guide in SAP Business Accelerator Hub.
  6. Sample configuration shown below.

      Shopify Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • Shopify Base Url: https://<yourshop>.myshopify.com/
  • Shopify Secure Parameter: The name of the Shopify access token secure parameter 

       SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Receiver Adapter Connection Configuration

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Base Url: https://<your-sap-s4-hana-instance-id>-api.s4hana.cloud.sap
  • Credential Name: The name of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition secure parameter 

🧩 Example Integration Flows:

  • Shopify ➜ SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition : Customer Replication, New Orders, Order Cancellations & Returns
  • SAP S4HANA Public Cloud Edition ➜ Shopify: Products, Inventory Synchronization, Stock Availability, Delivery Status

🚀Step 4: Deploy and Test the Integration Package in Integration Suite

  1. Deploy selected iFlows from your Design workspace.
  2. Monitor from Monitor > Integrations > Message Processing Logs.
  3. Perform test transactions: for more details refer to Demo section in the blog
    • Place a test order in Shopify.
    • Monitor the message logs and confirm data replication in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Sales Orders, Business Partners, Product Catalog

🔧 Extend or Customize the Package (Optional)

As a partner you can extend or tailor the integration through:

  • Customer Exits to plug-in your custom integration flows (Pre Exits and Post Exits in Intergration Flows)
  • Copy and modify the integration content.
  • Groovy scripts to customize payload mappings.
  • Content Modifiers to apply business logic.
  • Enhanced error handling and alerting.

 💡 Partner Tips & Monetization Opportunities

As an SAP Partner, you can:

  • 💡 Extend the integration flows and Build new integration flows using SAP Shopify adapte
  • 📜  Demo your solution with real-time order sync and inventory updates, build a demo to show real-time sync between Shopify and SAP with custom business case.
  • 🧰 Buildc Multi-Tenant Integration Templates for reuse across customers.
  • 🧠 Leverage SAP Integration Advisor for intelligent mapping.
  • 💡  Add your branding, services, or vertical-specific enhancements.

High Level Demo Flow to showcase Order processing along with Master data replication.

  • Step 1 : View the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify integration package in Integration Suite
  • Step 2: Show product in SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION  (to be replicated to shopify)
  • Step 3: Start replication of product in integration suite
  • Step 4: Show replicated product in Shopify and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product
  • Step 5: Log into shopify as customer and browse through existing products
  • Step 6: Select the product replicated from SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION and add to basket
  • Step 7: Enter the relevant details like payment and create order
  • Step 8: Check the order created in shopify
  • Step 9: Replicate the order from shopify to SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION
  • Step 10: Log into SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION as internal_sales_rep and look for “Manage Sales Order Version 2” app and open the sales order and change the order date to todays date (both in header and item level) and Save sales order
  • Step 11: Log into SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION as shipping_specialist and open app “Create outbound delivery with order reference”
  • Step 12: Enter shipping point and enter the sales order and shipping date as todays date and save , note down the Outbound Delivery ID
  • Step 13: Open app “pick outbound delivery” and enter Outbound Delivery ID and enter Actual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 07/01/2025) , enter picking quantity as 1 and save
  • Step 14 : Click on Post GI and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to Completely Processed. Note : show the SO Process flow of created order in SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION
  • Step 15 : Replicate the Outbound delivery from SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION public to Shopify .
  • Step 16: Open sales order in Shopify and show the OD created in SAP S/4HANA CLOUD PUBLIC EDITION reflected in metadata fields of Sales order and status of Sales Order is changed to fulfilled.

Detailed Demo steps:

Shopify Demo systems include the following systems - Integration Suite Tenant [along with BTP Sub-Account), SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Shopify Admin Portal, Shopify Customer Portal

Step 1:  Access the  Integration Suite tenant and view “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify” integration package

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to “Discover” -> “Integration”
  • Search for integration Package “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify”  , view the integration flows and details.          

Step 2: Access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition System to show the replicating product master

  • Access system using URL SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system as Product Master Specialist
  • Login with user = prodmaster_specialist
  • Launch the App : “Manage Product Master Data”  and search for Product ID  (sample product ID - TG11_PH_CW12)
  • Note: in the demo product replication integration flow we are replicating only one product with product ID (sample product ID - TG11_PH_CW12) and user could decide to replicate all products / sub-set of products, based on specific functional requirements.

Step 3: Start replication of product in Integration Suite

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Discover -> Integration (only first time)
  • Search for integration Package “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify”  , open the integration package -> copy the package
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API’s
  • Search for integration Package “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify”  ,
  • Navigate to “artifacts” and search for integration package “Replicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify”
  • Deploy the integration flow “Replicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify”
    • To deploy => click on the “3 dots” of integration package and select “deploy”
    • Deploy would start the product replication from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify      

Step 4: Show replicated product in Shopify and add picture and select the sales channel to be online store and activate the product

  • Login using URL : Shopify 
  • Navigate to “Products”
  • Check and prepare the product for selling to customer
    • Check the product is replicated
    • Add the picture to publish (click on “Media” and click on “+” and select the relevant picture”
  • Add the sales channel as online store ( click on “Manage” in “Publishing” section, in the popup select “online store”  and click on “include” and click on “done” )
  • Set the status of the product to be “Active” and “Save” the product
  • Note: for the product to be visible for customer in shopify portal for purchasing , the status must be set to “Active” and sales channel to be set to “online store”.      

Step 5: login to shopify as customer and browse through existing products

Step 6: select the product replicated from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and add to basket

  • Purchase the product (sample product ID - TG11_PH_CW12)
  • Select the product from catalog
  • Click on “Add to Cart” and click on “Checkout”
  • Account and ShipTo address would be filled automatically with the logged in user details

Step 7: enter the relevant details like payment and create order

  • Enter the Credit Card Details : Card Number, Expiration Date, Security Code
  • Click on “Pay Now”  , order would be placed

  • Check the order created with fulfillment status “Unfulfilled” , note down the “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Order ID”  , order ID would be used to search order created in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system      

Step 9: replicate the order from shopify to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API’s
  • Search for integration Package “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify”  , open the integration package -> navigate to Artifacts , search for artifact “Replicate Orders from Shopify to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition”
  • Deploy the integration flow “Replicate Products from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify”
  • Replication of orders in status Unfulfilled would be moved to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition .
  • Note: to check the status of replication by navigating to “Monitor” => “Integration and API’s” , check for “logs”      

Step 10: Log into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system as Sales Representative

  • open for “Manage Sales Order Version 2” app
  • open the sales order and change the “Requested Delivery Date” to todays date (both in header and item level) and Save sales order
  • Note: delivery date to be changed to today’s date, since user want to complete the delivery of the order today by creating outbound delivery today.       
     

Step 11: Log into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as Delivery shipping specialist and complete the delivery of Order

  • open for “Create outbound delivery with order reference” app

Step 12: Enter the key details like Shipping Point and Sales Order ...

  • enter shipping point sample as 3810 (select shipping point relevant for your use-case) and enter the sales order ID create earlier and Selection Date would be defaulted to todays date
  • click on “continue” and click on “save”
  • note down the outbound delivery ID

Step 13: Delivery shipping specialist will pic the outbound delivery

  • open app “pick outbound delivery” and enter “Delivery” id and enter “Actual GI Date DD/MM/YYYY (valid date, example 07/01/2025) , enter “picking quantity” as 1 and click on “save”         

Step 14 : Delivery shipping specialist will Post Goods Issue for the corresponding outbound delivery

  • click on “Post GI” and status of Outbound Delivery picking changes to “Completely Processed”.      

Note : show the Sales Order “Process flow” of created order in SAP S/4HANA Cloud  Public Edition for the corresponding order, the process flow gives visual representation of business entities created in the system (Order, Outbound Delivery, Invoice …)

Step 15 : replicate the Outbound delivery from S4 public to Shopify .

  • Open Integration Suite
  • Navigate to Design -> Integration and API’s
  • Search for integration Package “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify”  , open the integration package -> navigate to Artifacts , search for artifact “Replicate Orders from Shopify to SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition”
  • Deploy the integration flow “Replicate Delivery Details from SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition to Shopify”
  • Replication of outbound delivery from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system would be moved to Shopify and corresponding Order status would updated to “fulfilled” in Shopify
  • Note: to check the status of replication by navigating to “Monitor” => “Integration and API’s” , check for “logs”         

Step 16: open sales order in shopify and check the  status of Order, it should be changed from “Unfullfilled” to “fulfilled”

  • Navigate to “Orders”
  • With the successfully delivery , the order should be fulfilled and order status should be “Fulfilled” , note the fields “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Order ID”  and “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Outbound Deliveries”  in order would be copied from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system          

The above steps completes the High Level Demo Flow which showcase the order processing along with product master data replication.

Note: The  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Integration with Shopify integration package covers Order Returns and Order Cancellation business scenarios along with Order Processing, please feel free to explore the other business process like Order Returns and Order Cancellation .

entry.title: Developer Extensibility for Document and Reporting Compliance Türkiye in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
This blog post introduces a recent enhancement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition that significantly improves developer extensibility for the Document and Reporting Compliance solution in Türkiye. This change enables developers to fully utilize the SET_OUTPUT_DATA method in the EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD BAdI, which is used to modify the XML files generated for an electronic document. 

Background 
In some scenarios, you would want to enhance the standard XML file generated for an electronic document - for example, to add optional fields or make changes based on specific business or legal requirements. The Document and Reporting Compliance framework provides the SET_OUTPUT_DATA method within the EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD BAdI to support such enhancements. This method allows partners to tailor the generated XML output to meet their needs. This was possible in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud; however, it was not available in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, which limited flexibility for partners using the public cloud edition. 

However, until now, a key limitation with the Document and Reporting Compliance Türkiye solution was that its service consumer structures were not released. As a result, accessing and modifying XML content through ABAP structures was not straightforward. These structures needed to be made available by SAP for the respective country to enable developer extensibility. Without them, enhancements through the BAdI were either restricted or not feasible. 

What’s New? 
To remove this limitation, SAP has now released all proxy objects for the Türkiye Document and Reporting Compliance solution. As a result, developers can fully utilize the SET_OUTPUT_DATA method and enhance the XML output using standard proxy structures without any restrictions. 

Prerequisites 

  • You must have configured developer extensibility role in your configuration environment. 
    The required business role is SAP_BR_DEVELOPER. 

Implementation Steps in ABAP Development Tools (ADT): 

  1. In your ABAP project, go to the enhancement spot ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD (path: package GLO-EDO > Enhancements > Enhancement Spots). 
  2. Right-click ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD and select New BAdI Enhancement Implementation. 
  3. Enter a package, name, and description. 
  4. Choose Add BAdI Implementation and select for EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD. 
  5. Create a BAdI filter for Country (TR) and/or Generic Filter. 
  6. Choose Implementing Class to create a new implementation class. The new implementation class automatically implements the interfaces "if_badi_interfaces" and "if_edoc_adaptor_cloud". 
  7. After generating the class, open the interface method and press F3 to view its parameters. To display the documentation, press F2. 
  8. Activate your BAdI implementation. 

Example Implementation: 

To better illustrate how this enhancement can be used, we’ll walk through two examples, one for a Türkiye Basic eInvoice and another for a Delivery Note. 

Example 1: Türkiye Basic eInvoice 

In this example, we demonstrate how to enhance the XML output using the SET_OUTPUT_DATA method: 

  1. We populate the <PaymentMeansCode> XML tag with a custom value. This tag is located within the <PaymentMeans> tag of the XML structure. 
  2. We will also fill the <AdditionalDocumentReference> tag with custom values. 

These enhancements are made possible by leveraging the released proxy structures, allowing for seamless customization without any limitations. 

Sample Code:

PUBLIC 
FINAL 
CREATE PUBLIC . 
  PUBLIC SECTION. 
INTERFACES if_badi_interface . 
INTERFACES if_edoc_adaptor_cloud . 
PROTECTED SECTION. 
PRIVATE SECTION. 
ENDCLASS. 

 CLASS zcl_tr_inv_cloud_badi IMPLEMENTATION. 

 METHOD if_edoc_adaptor_cloud~set_output_data. 
 
  ASSIGN COMPONENT 'DOC_DATA' OF STRUCTURE cs_output_data TO FIELD-SYMBOL(<lv_data>). 
  IF <lv_data> IS ASSIGNED. 
 * Do Nothing
  ELSE. 
    IF iv_edoc_type = 'TR_BINV'. 
      IF iv_interface_id <> 'TR_GETSTATUS_REQ'. 
        ASSIGN COMPONENT 'PARAMETERS' OF STRUCTURE cs_output_data TO <lv_data>. 
        IF <lv_data> IS ASSIGNED. 
          ASSIGN cs_output_data TO <lfs_cs_doc_data>. 
          IF <lfs_cs_doc_data> IS ASSIGNED. 
            ASSIGN <lfs_cs_doc_data>-parameters-package-elements TO <fs_invoice_tab>. 
            IF <fs_invoice_tab> IS ASSIGNED.

                ASSIGN <fs_invoice_el>-element_list-invoice-payment_means 
                   TO <fs_payment_means_tab>. 
                CLEAR ls_payment_means. 
                ls_payment_means-payment_means_code-base-base-content = '31'. 
                APPEND ls_payment_means TO <fs_payment_means_tab>. 
 
                ASSIGN <fs_invoice_el>-element_list-invoice-additional_document_reference 
                                TO <fs_add_doc_ref>. 
 
                ls_issuedate = '20250520'. 
 
                CLEAR ls_additional_Ref. 
                ls_additional_ref-id-base-base-content = 'www.sovos.com'. 
                ls_additional_ref-issue_date-base-content = ls_issuedate. 
                ls_additional_ref-document_type_code-base-base-content = 'EUPRWEBURI'. 

                APPEND ls_additional_Ref TO <fs_add_doc_ref>.               ENDLOOP. 
            ENDIF. 
          ELSE. 
*        elseblock

      ENDIF. 
    ENDIF. 
  ENDIF. 
ENDMETHOD. 
ENDCLASS.

Result: 

When you display the XML file of the electronic document in the eDocument Cockpit (EDOC_COCKPIT), you will see that the <PaymentMeansCode> and <AdditionalDocumentReference> tag are now filled: 

Example 2: Delivery Note 

In this example, we show how to enhance the XML output for a Delivery Note document: 

  • We populate the <DeliveryAddress> XML tag with custom values, specifically filling the postbox and postalzone values.

PUBLIC

PROTECTED SECTION.

CLASS zcl_tr_inv_cloud_badi IMPLEMENTATION.

  IF <lv_data> IS ASSIGNED.

IF iv_interface_id <> 'TR_DELN_ENVE_STAT_REQUEST'. 
      ASSIGN COMPONENT 'PACKAGE' OF STRUCTURE cs_output_data TO <lv_data>. 
      IF <lv_data> IS ASSIGNED. 
        ASSIGN cs_output_data TO <lfs_cs_doc_data2>. 
        IF <lfs_cs_doc_data2> IS ASSIGNED. 
 
          READ TABLE <lfs_cs_doc_data2>-package-elements ASSIGNING <fs_element> INDEX 1. 
 
          ls_shipment = <fs_element>-element_list-despatch_advice-shipment. 
          ls_shipment-delivery-delivery_address-postbox-base-base-content = '54321'. 
          ls_shipment-delivery-delivery_address-postal_zone-base-base-content = '54321'. 
          <fs_element>-element_list-despatch_advice-shipment  = ls_shipment. 
        ELSE. 
*        elseblock 
        ENDIF. 
      ENDIF. 
    ENDIF. 
ENDIF. 
  ENDIF. 
ENDMETHOD. 
ENDCLASS.

Result: 

When you display the XML file of the electronic document in the eDocument Cockpit (EDOC_COCKPIT) , you will see that the <DeliveryAddress> tag are now filled: 

Conclusion 
With recent enhancements to the Türkiye Document and Reporting Compliance solution, SAP has made it significantly easier to tailor electronic document outputs. The necessary structures are now fully available for use within the SET_OUTPUT_DATA method of the EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD BAdI. This allows developers to add or adjust XML elements and populate optional fields based on specific business or legal requirements, without facing previous limitations. 

This improvement gives you more flexibility and helps ensure compliance with Türkiye’s legal requirements. It also speeds up development, as you no longer need to wait for SAP to release specific proxy objects.

entry.title: Important Information About Converting Renumbered G/L Accounts with an Active Parallel Line:
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We've recently gotten some feedback regarding a specific point in the conversion process for renumbered G/L accounts and wanted to take a quick minute to spread the word as widely as possible.

When you're converting renumbered G/L accounts on a three-system landscape, that conversion process means a development system downtime (typically 2-4 hours). During this downtime, your business users can't access the SAP Fiori launchpad, so day-to-day business in the development system is blocked for that period of time.

So far, so good. But what if you have an active parallel line? 

In that case, the conversion process means a downtime for both development systems at the same time. It doesn't matter whether or not the accounts were branched (from the main line to the parallel line, or vice versa) or whether they exist in one line only: Converting renumbered G/L accounts in either  the main line or  the parallel line means a downtime for the development system across both lines.

Please keep this in mind when you're scheduling the conversion process for your renumbered G/L accounts!

As always, further information can be found on the SAP Help Portal.

And of course, if you have follow-up questions here, or want to know more about the renumbering process for your G/L accounts, feel free to ask in the comments--we can answer or make new posts to clarify additional issues that arise!
