- 下载必需的CBC/SSCUI配置步骤清单以识别所需权限，确认你在系统中具有相应权限
- 从CBC系统中找到配置步骤，进入重复检查配置页面
- 根据业务需要设定规则优先级和筛选条件
- 启用并保存设置，让系统自动执行检查

 

详细操作指南

1. 获取权限

在配置重复性检查之前，参考以下步骤，确保自己拥有足够的权限。
- 登录SAP For Me，在顶部搜索栏中打开“SAP Signavio Process Navigator”。
- 找到“Implementation”标签下的“Accelerators（加速器）”区域，下载“Configuration apps”中的Excel清单（示意图1）。
- 查阅Excel文档，确认所需的CBC/SSCUI ID（如100274）和Business Catalog ID。
- 在系统中打开“Business Catalog”应用，找到相应的“Business Role”，为自己分配相应权限角色（示意图2）。


【示意图1：下载配置清单】 


【示意图2：权限角色分配界面】

 

2. 配置重复检查【操作步骤】

- 进入配置界面：使用CBC/SSCUI ID（如100274）搜索“Configure Matching and Duplication Check”（示意图3）。
- 创建新配置：在“Manage Match Configurations”界面，点击“Add Configuration”按钮（示意图4-5），命名如“T_NUM_D”，描述为“税号重复检查”。


【示意图3：配置搜索界面】 


【示意图4：添加配置按钮】 


【示意图5：新配置填写界面】

- 选择比对字段和匹配规则：例如“Tax Number（税号）”作为关键字段。
- 设定匹配类型：完全匹配、部分匹配或模糊匹配（示意图6）。
- 设定规则优先级和筛选条件：比如优先级：税号 > 业务名称。
- 筛选范围：可以设置只检查特定客户类型或地区。
- 设置为默认规则：确保此规则自动应用于所有新建或更新的业务伙伴。
- 保存配置：确认无误后，点击“Save”完成设置。


【示意图6：选择字段和匹配方式、优先级和筛选配、设为默认规则】

 

验证

为了检验，我们跳转去管理业务伙伴的应用。在创建新的业务伙伴时，如果输入重复的信息，您将看到类似的报错消息。

【示意图7：报错消息示例】

 

附录

SAP当前更推荐使用Fiori应用来管理业务流程。Fiori提供了更现代化、更易于使用的界面，大多数业务功能已经在Fiori中得到增强和优化。不过，为了提供更全面的支持，以下内容展示了如何通过WebGUI进行激活的相关步骤，这可以作为理解旧版流程的参考。

  • 激活重复检查：进入配置界面，使用CBC/SSCUI配置步骤102415以激活税号类别重复检查。在维护税号类别应用中，将需要检查的税号更改为“开”（示意图8）。

【示意图8: 维护税号类别应用】

  • 验证重复检查：接下来，在业务伙伴管理应用中验证税号类别重复检查是否已生效。

【示意图9：进入业务伙伴管理应用】

【示意图10：填写重复的税号信息】

  • 转换信息消息为错误消息：配置步骤CBC/SSCUI 103601可以将重复税编号的消息控制从信息提示改为Error报错（示意图10-11）。

接下来的示例是演示如何将这个检查重复项的info的信息提示改为Error报错信息。通过配置步骤CBC/SSCUI 103601进入更改重复税编号的消息控制的应用。将400的信息改为“E“ Error报错。

【示意图11: 将信息类别400更改为E】

【示意图12: 在维护业务伙伴界面输入重复的税号提示设置错误】

尽管以上WebGUI配置步骤可以帮助理解传统操作，但是对于新项目和实现，建议您优先选择Fiori界面，其更加直观、用户友好且与现代业务需求更契合。

entry.title: Controlling, Scheduling, and Costing of Production Using Custom Fields in Routing Based on AVC
entry.content:
In today's competitive market, understanding and managing production costs is crucial for businesses. With the help of custom field creation and Advanced Variant Configuration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, company "X" can calculate production costs based on configuration, making these costs visible at the sales order level. 

Key Steps in the Solution

  1. Creating Custom Field
  2. Setting Up Configurable Material
  3. Integrating Workcenter Formula
  4. Setting Object Dependency and Characteristics
  5. Executing Business Processes

Creating Custom Fields

Company X uses a custom field, YY1_price_factor, within Production Routing. This field is set up using the Key User Extensibility's Custom Field App, under the Business Context: Manufacturing Bill of Operations Operation. The custom field is crucial for linking production routing operations to sales orders.

  1. Choose Add Field in the Custom Fields app.

    The custom field YY1_price_factor is created for production routing operations.

  2. Enable the business scenario Routing to Production Order on Operation Level for the custom field YY1_price_factor.
  3. Optional: Enable the GUI in the User Interface tab if you wish to see the fields in the UI.

 

Setting Up Configurable Material

  1. Set the configurable material as described. The configurable material CM-MLFL-KM-VXX is associated with class AVC_CL_COMMON_VXX of class type 300. Characteristics such as AVC_CR_COUNTERWEIGHT_VXX or AVC_CR_FORKLIFT_VXX are used to execute sales order variant configurations.
  2. Select the UsedfVarConfig checkbox.

 

Integrating Workcenter (WKC) Formula 

  1. Map the custom field YY1_price_factor to the WKC formula parameter AZMDB1 in the Define Parameters activity. In your configuration environment, use the search function to open the configuration activities. For more information, see also Configuration Environment of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  2. Create a WKC where the SAP standard parameter SAP_01 is multiplied by ZMDB1 to calculate costs in the Define Formulas for Work Centers activity. In your configuration environment, use the search function to open the configuration activities.For more details, see Step-by-Step Guide to Setting Up Custom Fields in Work Center Formula Parameters. For more details, see the blog Step-by-Step Guide to Setting Up Custom Fields in Work Center Formula Parameters.

Setting Object Dependency and Characteristics

To utilize YY1_price_factor in object dependency, it is referenced to the characteristic AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX. This characteristic is calculated using a procedure in production routing, ensuring accurate cost calculations based on configuration changes.

  1. Create characteristics AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX using the Manage Characteristics app.
  2. Reference the characteristic to the PLPO table with the field name YY1_price_factor_PPO in the Addnl data tab.
  3. Assign characteristic AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX to class AVC_CL_COMMON_VXX using the  Manage Classes app.
  4. Assign the class AVC_CL_COMMON_VXX to the configured material in Manage Product Master Data.
  5. Create a global procedure with the characteristics AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX.
  6. Maintain dependency with type Procedure.
  7. Enter the formula in the Dependency Editor.

 

Executing Business Processes

Sales Order Impact

When a sales order is created for CM-MLFL-KM-VXX, the calculated cost and profit margin are displayed. Changes in configuration, such as altering the counterweight from 2,000 kg to 5,000 kg, dynamically adjust the costing and profit margin.

      1. Set the counterweight to 2,000 kg in Variant Configuration.

        The profit margin is calculated for 2,000 kgs. 

        This solution focuses on calculating the production cost based on the configuration and displaying it on the sales order. It doesn't deal with sales order processes as a whole. The multiplier that Company X uses is created as a custom field (called YY1_price_factor) in Production Routing.

      2. Set the counterweight to 5,000 kgs in Variant Configuration.The profit margin is calculated for 5,000 kgs. 

Production Order Impact

In production orders, the custom field price_factor reflects changes in sales order configurations. For instance, changing the counterweight from 2,000 kg to 5,000 kg adjusts the price_factor from 2 to 5, demonstrating the direct impact of configuration changes on production costs.

  1. Search for the material CM-MLFL-KM-VXX in the Manage Material Coverage app.

     

  2. Choose Start MRP Run to create a planned order.

     

  3. Convert the planned order to a production order. Once the production order is created, check the User Field price_factor in Operations. For counterweight 2,000 KG, the price_factor is 2.

     

  4. Now, if this counterweight is changed in the sales order variant config to 5,000 KG, and the MRP run happens again to create the production order in the same way as described above. The price_factor changes to 5 as shown below. 

By integrating custom fields and formulas, Company X provides a streamlined approach to managing production costs, enhancing visibility and accuracy in sales orders and production processes. This solution empowers businesses to make informed decisions and optimize their operations.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508: Final What's New & Product Assistance available
entry.content:
With immediate effect, the final What's New information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 is now available.

To access the final What’s New information, please use the What’s New Viewer.

In addition, the final Product Assistance (aka Application Help) for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 is available. Please use the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Help Portal page to access it.

For you as a customer, we recommend to also use the Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool.

The Release Assessment and Scope Dependency (RASD) tool provides you with a personalized and tailored view on What’s New information based on the activated and used scope within your system. The information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 will be available in RASD within the next few days. A valid Customer S-user ID is required for login. We recommend to use RASD to prepare for upgrades and updates of your system and to focus on the new and changed features that are relevant for you as a customer.

You can use the commenting feature for What’s New. With this feature, authors can evaluate your feedback and incorporate it into the documentation, if needed. We hope that by opening this channel of communication, we can learn how to further improve our What’s New content for you. To use this feature, you need to be logged into the Help Portal. The feature will only be available in the English version of the documents. To learn more about how the feedback process works in SAP Help Portal, see Giving Documentation Feedback.
